text: i did an update and upgrade and now I have no sound.  How can I fix this please?
the kernel must have updated.  Did you have to tweak stuff before to get the sound owrking?
what sort of audio device do you have?  If you don't know, type `lspci` in a terminal and look for your audio device.
there's a link in ubuntuforums.org.  just a sec.
whats pastebin can I use to show you?
you just need to download the latest alsa drivers, that's all.  worked for me at least.
did you see my pastebin result?
yeah.  you have the identical one that i have.
so that website worked for you?
do I type: sudo apt-get install build-essential ncurses-dev ?
yeah.  just follow those instructions.  be sure not to mix the 1.0.12 stuff with the 1.0.13 stuff, and be sure to adjust the commands for 1.0.12.  it's only a matter of changing one number.
i rebooted for the third time and now sound works.  I didnt even have to follow that website.  What on earth causes this?  Why does sond work sometimes, and not other times?
does the sound die when you try to adjust the volume?
when you increase the volume or anything, does it die?
the sound just dies for not explicable reason?
oh.  you're running Feisty.  Could be anything.
may be a bug in Feisty.  give it time (the 19th) and see if everything is squared away by then.
never!  the sound works great therought the wholw day edgy is running.  Its just that no sound happens when I first turn on my PC in the morning, and I ghave to reboot 3-5 times to get sound workoing
I don't know.  Since Feisty is still in alpha, it may be anything.
I never said I use feisty
oh.  sorry.   try following the instructions on that link anyway.  it'll probably help.  it's been updated, too, so just follow them verbatim, i.e. copy/paste them into a terminal.
im worried that link may make sound totally stop working for good
try not to worry.  it won't do that.
is there any way of taking a snapshot of his system is now and rollback in case it does?
and you're not guaranteed your sound issue will ever be resolved, either.
I think so.  watch the bot.
that website says: f your boot hangs on loading the module for snd-hda-intel.  But this doesnt apply to me
I know how to back up the whole system
neither did mine.  but it resolved my sound issue.
im talking about a little snapshot
yeah but you  never had sound at all.  But I get sound every 3-5 reboots :P
ok im ready :)  can you help me through it?
i'm in the chat you created.  where you?
im not getting any text from you in PM!  can you pls come to #billy
I'm not sure what's going on.  let's just go through it in the room here.
installed the build-essentials and ncurses yet?
it said: linux-headers-2.6.17-11-generic is already the newest version.
that command didn t do anything
you should be in /home/yourname, but it ought not matter.
download this file to /home/ejoy/installers/alsa :  wait, use this one.  it's the latest.  http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa/ftp/driver/alsa-driver-1.0.14rc2.tar.bz2
where is the alsa folder we created?  / ?
ok done!  copied it to alsa
copy this one to the same location : http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa/ftp/lib/alsa-lib-1.0.14rc2.tar.bz2
thats the same filename as before
ok done! both files are now in als
ok 3 files are now in alsa
do I type sudo mkdir -p /usr/src/alsa from wihin the alsa folder?
yes.  from what I understand, it's equivalent to saying 'here' in computer language.
that last one said: tar: alsa-utils-1.0.14rc1.tar.bz2: Cannot open: No such file or directory. tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
tar: Child returned status 2., tar: Error exit delayed from previous errors
WARNING!!! The mixer channels for the ALSA driver are muted by default!!!
shoild I make that sudo make install-modules as crimsun said?
crimsun is probably more knowledgable than I am.  but this worked fine for me.  not sure about mixing the command at this poitn.
reboot.  hopefully that'll fix your sound.
i thought we had to complile the 3rd downloaded file as well/. no?
we did.  it's all done now.
ok ill reboot and tell you how it went
I just rechecked.  we did everything.
I have no sound whatsoever now :(
you'll go through a step by step process.  just be sure to use hda-intel as your device.  and unmute the channels.
it saus if I want to modify modprobe.conf
it finished with  For adjustment of volumes, use your favorite mixer.
alsamixer: function snd_mixer_load failed: Invalid argument
do you have a volume control in your panel?
i still have no sound!  and the colume control in panel is at 100%
right click the volume control.  select preferences.
now the volume controls is misbehaving.  it jumps up and down when I try to move it
its not an option! i cant see HDA Intel (Alsa mixer)
it only has 1 option; says Realtec ALC660 (OSS mixer)
and now the volume controls is misbehaving.  it jumps up and down when I try to move it
has this problem got anything to do with what crimsun said?
maybe.  worked fine for me though.
at least before I had sound when I rebooted a few times.  And I asked you if this can make it totally stop working all togetjer, and I trusted you as you said THAT WONT HAPPEN :(
now I cant get sound at all :(
and when  I type alsamixer it says: alsamixer: function snd_mixer_load failed: Invalid argument
i trusted you :(  and now my sound is stuffed
when I ran sudo alsaconf, it didnt run any mixer or volume control
not sure why alsaconf is returning an error.  those wiki instructions have worked well for myself and others.  i'm looking into the error now.  please be patient.
when I ran sudo alsaconf, it didnt run any mixer or volume control,  but it didnt give an error; it only says: Now ALSA is ready to use.
and why does the volume control now jumps up and down when I try to move it?
yeah it says: alsamixer: function snd_mixer_load failed: Invalid argument
you're sure there's no alternative in the dropdown box in the preferences of the volume manager?
how can I get it back to the way it was?  at last sound worked when I rebooted a fw times
it only has 1 option; says Realtec ALC660 (OSS mixer)!  NO other option
I right click on sound icon and chose Preferences.  but there is only 1 options there; Realtec ALC660 (OSS mixer)
i was worried about this happening. I should have kept it as it was :(
is there any way or returning to how it was?
in the Sound Playback drop down box, is there an ALSA option?
says ALSA Advanced Linux Sound Acrhitcutre
TEST has no sound at all
click the Sounds tab.  look at the bottom at the Default sound card.  Is it HDA Intel?
good? LOL   but sound is broken
it's ONE thing.  go back to Devices and select everything to ALSA.
any other ideas befoire I cry and have to wipe who Edgy which took me 3 weeks to set up :(
let me try a quick reboot first
System > Preferences > Sound .  ALSA for all.
and why does the sound bar jump up and down wildly when I try to slide it?
check the Sound Manager > Preferences again.  It does that because your sound is configured to use ALSA and the volume manager is set to OSS.
mine used to do the same thing.
heck the Sound Manager > Preferences again????
why?  it still shows the same
what have u done to me? :(
what am I going to do now?  i spent 3-4 weeks setting this system up :(
I told you i was worried doing that as it may make sound totally stop working!  and you said NO WAY, it wont do that
ok im terying to be relaxed :P
you're going to add a line to that file.
want me to copy ans pastebin the whole file?
we're going to try a couple of different flavours, which will take a couple of reboots to see if we've gotten the right one.  it'll take a couple of steps, so please be patient.
that file is loaded: gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
we're going to try different flavours.  `gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base`
ok delete the loine we added before?
again, we're going to try a different flavour.  `gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base`
my sound worked perfect before.  the only prob I had was I needed to reboot 2-3 times before sound worked
hope everything gets working right.  sorry I hosed your system.
its not what you do that counts, in the intent beghind it. and your intention were good.  ty anyway
hello. thanksd for trying to help me and my sound earlier
I hope you didnt feel too bad
no, pls dont be.  your intent was good and you tried very hard. its not what we do that counts as much as the intent behind it
i got it working again by reinstalling the sound drivers from default edgy install
so i got sound again. so dont worry :)
good.  still having to reboot to get the sound?
crimsun gave me a command that put sound drivers back as it was.  and now i have sound.  the only bummer is that I have to reload ubuntu a few times to get sound. but i can live with it :P
yeah, a few times.  but sometimes im lucky and it works first boot
well, that sucks, in my humble opinion.  you're wearing out your system just to get freakin' sound.
sometimes it works first boot, and others the 2nd or third boot
i have no choice :(   im not going to try to insyall anything again after 3 hours today :P
ill have to live with it
as i said, sometimes im lucky and it works first boot. eg, tonight i turned it on and sound worked first time :)
thanks a lot for today.  you were very patient and tried your best to help me.  i deeply appreciate it
thanks.  but I still feel like I totally burned you.  I still have an idea, but I think we're both a little burnt out on it.
is ALSA what you're using now?
well you didnt burn me as I said earlier, its your intent that counts.  you didnt purposely try to burn me. its was just an affect of good will.
the only thing different is when I right click on speaker icon and chose Preferences, it now has HDA intel Salsa mixer selceted
thanks for that.  really helps.  just curious.  is ALSA what's driving your sound?
after what we did, that wasnt available. and thats what causesd no sound I think
when I right click on speaker icon and chose Preferences, it now has HDA intel Salsa mixer selceted
that's good.  at least it's using ALSA now.
I still think that adding a `options snd-hda-intel model=laptop` to `/etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base` may help though.  It'd be really easy to delete the line if it didn't work.
what does options snd-hda-intel model=laptop do?
tells your setup that you've got a laptop, basically.
im too scared to change anything again :P
well.  it's a far easier fix (just delete the line) than having to re-install modules.  :)
have you opened it FTP *and* SMTP?
i think its called UDP or something
there's an option especially for torrent programs in the drop down menu.
when you go to 'Add Rule' for Allow Service.
your firewall is blocking ktorrent right?
no!  seems my router. because when I close firewall, it says its closed
so when firewall is closed, its still closed the port.  but I port forwared it on my router.  im confused
i've never worked with a router.  sorry i can't help you there.
be careful about naming ports in open forums.
its not my proper port :)  i know
I have the gparted live cd ISO
I have gparted live on disc.  i'm all good, over here.

so mayne something you and I did, helped that to happen. :) so thanks :)
it was probably just an initial install bug or something.  glad it's worked out for you.  ALSA wasn't even installed, so what we did ~may~ have helped.
it was annyoing havint to boot Ubuntu 2-3 times to get sound., but that doesnt happen anymore
plus you were wearing out your hardware doing that.  not cool.
yeah. and wghats your prob today?
booting ubuntu wears out my hardware?  not much though, right?
well, booting over and over again into wears it out faster, no matter what OS you're running.
